```{r setup, include=FALSE}
# setup chunk options
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = FALSE,
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>", 
  tidy = TRUE
)

# load packages
# packages for data import
library(REDCapR)
library(ncdfFlow)

# packages for data manipulation
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(purrr)
library(lubridate)
library(janitor)
library(skimr)
library(data.table)

# packages for data export
library(writexl)
```

## Import data
### - csv or excel data
<font color="grey"><i> 
read.csv("file/data_grouping/metadata_grouping.csv") 
</i></font>

### - REDcap data
<font color="grey"><i>
redcap_read(redcap_uri = api.uri, token = api.token, raw_or_label = 'label',verbose = FALSE) 
</i></font>

### - flow cytometry data
<font color="grey"><i>
read.ncdfFlowSet(fcsFiles) 
</i></font>

### - other types of data

## Summarize the raw data
<font color="grey"><i> 
dplyr::glimpse(raw_df)  
ggplot(data = raw_df, aes(x = x_var, y = y_var, color = col_var)) + geom_boxplot() 
</i></font>

## Clean data

## Summarize transformed data
<font color="grey"><i> 
dplyr::glimpse(clean_df)  
ggplot(data = clean_df, aes(x = x_var, y = y_var, color = col_var)) + geom_boxplot() 
</i></font>

## Export data
### - export to csv or excel 
<font color="grey"><i> 
write.csv(clean_df, "clean_df.csv")  
write_xlsx(list(worksheet_name = clean_df), "clean_df.xlsx") 
</i></font>
